title: Drawing, "Design for Woven Textile-Linstripe, Series #425", 1959
signed: In graphite, lower right: ALEXANDER GIRARD / ARCHITECT
inscribed: In graphite, below each sectional column: 1-5; "color" repeated seven times; in pencil, below image: THIS DRAWING ACTUAL SIZE OF PATTERN;  in graphite, lower right in block: DATE: 25 FEB 1959/ SCALE: 1:1 / BY: pd / Job No. / Drawings No./ ALEXANDER GIRARD / ARCHITECT / P.O.BOX 707 / SANTE FE, NEW MEXICO
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of thirty-five vertical columns with narrow horizontal stripes-annotated as for blueprint

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Woven Textile-Linstripe, Series #425", 1959.Graphite on tracing paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-295.
